solver.search.strategy.selectors

Interface VariableSelector<V extends Variable>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AntiFirstFail, Cyclic, FirstFail, InputOrder, Largest, MaxDelta, MaxRegret, MinDelta, Occurrence, Random, Smallest, VariableSelectorWithTies

    public interface VariableSelector<V extends Variable>
extends Serializable
    A variable selector specifies which variable should be selected at a fix point. It is based specifications (ex: smallest domain, most constrained, etc.).
    Basically, the variable selected should not be already instantiated to a singleton (although it is allowed).
    Since:
    2 juil. 2010
    Author:
    Charles Prud'homme

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V getVariable(V[] variables)
      Provides access to the current selected variable among variables.

    • Method Detail

      • getVariable

        V getVariable(V[] variables)
        Provides access to the current selected variable among variables. If there is no variable left, return null.
        Returns:
        the current selected variable if any, null otherwise.
